title: Zhonya's Contradicts Ryze's Ult
body: Ryze's ult reads- Ryze can move around and cast spells during this channel, which can be interrupted by both **SILENCING** and  **IMMOBILIZING **effects. He should not be allowed to use his ultimate, pop Zhonyas, and be carried away to safety. Zhonyas is an immobilizing effect that you put on yourself. It completely contradicts how you should be able to counter play his ultimate. Why is this like this.

replies.body: people always complain about this but he's not rooted during his ult which is why he can zhonyas while casting it, same thing with morgana, and same thing with kennen, if they can move during their ult they can zhonyas, it's never been special to ryze, it's a mechanic in league

The difference here is that Kennen, Morgana, Swain etc won't stop their ults if someone CC's them.
So Zhonya not stopping their ults should not surprise anyone.

Then there's Anivia for example, if she gets CC'd her ult stops, and she can't keep her ult up in Zhoyna.
Ryze is almost the same, because his ult specifically states it's interrupted by CC, but for some reason Zhonya's is the exception...

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-610-notes

Actually, Riot changed the interaction with Glacial Storm and Zhonya's Hourglass in 6.10. It stays active even if Anivia uses Zhonya's Hourglass.

Another case of this is Aurelion Sol's passive, which stays active if he uses Zhonya's Hourglass even though other CC will interrupt it.

By this logic it's fairly reasonable for Ryze to be able to use his ultimate through Zhonya's.

Damn. I actually did not know that. 

My bad then lol
I chalk it up to poor wording in the description rather than a flaw in the gameplay itself.

because zhonyas isn't cc, especially if it doesn't come from an enemy, it's how the game is coded
It is CC. Zhonya's Hourglass Active applies a form of Hard Crowd Controll called Stasis.
Stasis does not, for all intents and purposes, count as harmful CC. Only harmful CC stops Ryze ult.
It may not be harmful, but it definetly is ''immobilising'' and ''silencing''

* You can't move/cast while Knocked Up
* You can't move/cast while Stunned
* You can't move/cast while Suppressed

On top of that, Zhonya's is supposed to render you untargetable, meaning that practically no effect should be able to affect you during that time, bar Soraka's ult, which is special-cased to heal everyone no matter what. It sounds like Ryze's ult is also special-cased to work with Zhonya's, but considering how practically every other long-ranged blink is saddled with a long, easily interrupted channel time, I don't think Realm Warp should really be an exception to this, particularly since Ryze's status as a battle mage means he should be one of the champions least deserving of a get-out-of-jail-free card (he's meant to commit to fights, not simply skirmish).
